title: Help with Stationary US papersizes
content:
I know i should request these details from the printer  
however the client i’m working for is on vacation and i needed to have these finished by the time he’s back. However to make my work a little double later on, i would like (of course if you guys don’t mind) to have the paper sizes for the following items:

A4 envelope (obviously an A4? O\_O )  
cd cover & sticker  
Letter Head  
notepad & desk pad  
small envelope( actually a normal size envelope)

Thats it.  
Thanks!

ps. is there a website that has all these basic stuff layed out for print work?  
ie. business card, and most of what i mentioned above.

 [‹ Beginners problems with FontForge](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105927/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35589 "Go to previous forum topic") [U+0192 ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105927/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35138 "Go to next forum topic")
author: battlefield

comments.content:
wikipedia is all knowing:

[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paper\_size](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009105927/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paper_size "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paper\_size")

you should be able to find everything in there except maybe CD packaging, but AFAIK, CD packages are universal globally.
No offense, but you probably would have found that if you typed in something like ’paper sizes’ in google... ;)

Yea, i probably would.  
but actually was looking for a more specific sizes that you guys used for some other stationary items.

Thanks!
